file_content.text: We should hear back from the weapons manufacturers soon.
You survived! Tell me--was I right? Did you find any wonderfully incriminating evidence?
I thought you said those mercenaries were tough?
Of course I survived.
They are--or should I say were? Obviously, your reputation for dealing out death is well-deserved. Thank you for your help.
I found a few things those mercenaries wouldn't let go of without a fight.
I think so.
I'm sure. The Republic pays well to keep their dirty little secrets.
Those mercs were tough.
I admit I was a bit worried, but obviously your reputation for dealing out death is well-deserved.
I've already been in touch with my Imperial contacts. They're eager to see what the vault kept hidden.
You'd better get a move on. There's a possibility Revaak might call in reinforcements.
You didn't complete the job, so you don't get the money.
You didn't tell me the vault was guarded by Revaak and his mercs. I lost two of my best men.
Then obviously I misjudged your expertise. Now please leave.
Perfect! Just the group I'm looking for! I take it you overheard my little problem?
My lord! Your reputation precedes you. And may I say, it wholly fails to do you credit. I take it you overheard my little... disagreement?
Ah--just the sort I need to see. Your reputation precedes you, hunter. Did you overhear my problem?
Sir! Greetings to you. I've heard about you, but I never thought I'd have the honor... I take it you overheard my little disagreement?
I think people in the next sector overheard.
It was hard not to.
Yes, Arak can be a little... excitable.
Sounds like someone messed up big time.
You're in real trouble.
You don't know the half of it.
Your petty problems don't interest me.
Why would I bother listening?
You stick to your own business. I like that.
My name is Cathan Dru. It's my job to... pass along information that might benefit the Empire. If you know what I mean.
I recently came across a corporate vault the Republic desperately needs to keep secret. Arak was supposed to bring me its contents.
Let me guess--he talked big but couldn't deliver.
I take it he failed.
You could say that. We didn't know the vault was guarded by Revaak and his mercenaries. They... didn't take kindly to Arak's attack.
What is the Republic so desperate to keep hidden?
What's in the vault?
Do I look interested to you?
I'm hoping you could do what Arak couldn't.
The vault contains documents from companies that handle the Republic's weapons programs--evidence of aborted experiments, biological accidents, minutes of secret meetings.
With that evidence, we could blackmail the manufacturers to work for us instead of the Republic.
It would get the Empire legions of new droids and ships. Perhaps a venture worth your time?
Those who aid the Republic will fall before my hand.
Of course.
We'll squeeze those corporations until they crumble into dust.
Of course.
Mercenaries won't deter me.
Nothing could be simpler.
And I'll do it with one hand tied behind my back.
No problem.
How tough are these mercs?
Revaak's men are the toughest mercs on the planet. They'll outnumber you--and the vault's defenses are also considerable.
But bring the documents to me and I'll see that the balance of power shifts.
[Refuse Quest] Doubtful.
Oh... of course. Sorry to have troubled you. I'll just have to find someone else.
I can't talk now. I'm waiting on someone.
